get.summary: Gets an AdditionalTable
get.description: Gets the AdditionalTable with id={additionalTableId}

parameters.name: reviewId
parameters.description: ReviewId of the Review

parameters.name: additionalTableId
parameters.description: Id of the AdditionalTable

parameters.name: download
parameters.description: Triggers the browser to set the download flag. The parameter is the filename

parameters.name: envelope
parameters.description: Surround the result with additional information

parameters.name: excluded
parameters.description: Comma separated list of fields that should be excluded from the result. It is not possible to set both excluded and included. Default value is set to: versionTime, createdBy, createdByClientId, deletedBy, deletedByClientId, versionNo

parameters.name: included
parameters.description: Comma separated list of fields that should be included in the result. It is not possible to set both excluded and included.

parameters.name: print
parameters.description: PrettyPrint (print=pretty) the result or don't send anything back in the payload (print=silent)

parameters.name: metadata
parameters.description: Add additional metadata as links and total count

parameters.name: time
parameters.description: Specify a timestamp in millis for versioned data

parameters.name: expand
parameters.description: Expand tableBody and/or footnotes inside the AdditionalTable

put.description: Updates the additionalTable with id={additionalTableId}

parameters.name: reviewId
parameters.description: ReviewId of the Review

parameters.name: additionalTableId
parameters.description: Id of the AdditionalTable

delete.description: Deletes the additionalTable with the id={additionalTableId}

parameters.name: reviewId
parameters.description: ReviewId of the Review

parameters.name: additionalTableId
parameters.description: Id of the AdditionalTable

patch.description: Patches the additionalTable with id={additionalTableId}. Will only update the values explicitly listed in the response. It is NOT possible to set a value to Null - if this is needed, PUT should be used instead.

parameters.name: reviewId
parameters.description: ReviewId of the Review

parameters.name: additionalTableId
parameters.description: Id of the AdditionalTable

get.summary: Gets a collection of additionalTables from the review
get.description: Gets all AdditionalTables from the review

parameters.name: reviewId
parameters.description: ReviewId of the Review

parameters.name: download
parameters.description: Triggers the browser to set the download flag. The parameter is the filename

parameters.name: envelope
parameters.description: Surround the result with additional information

parameters.name: excluded
parameters.description: Comma separated list of fields that should be excluded from the result. It is not possible to set both excluded and included. Default value is set to: versionTime, createdBy, createdByClientId, deletedBy, deletedByClientId, versionNo

parameters.name: included
parameters.description: Comma separated list of fields that should be included in the result. It is not possible to set both excluded and included.

parameters.name: print
parameters.description: PrettyPrint (print=pretty) the result or don't send anything back in the payload (print=silent)

parameters.name: metadata
parameters.description: Add additional metadata as links and total count

parameters.name: time
parameters.description: Specify a timestamp in millis for versioned data

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: Get a specific page in the result

parameters.name: pages
parameters.description: Get relative page links in the result header. Must be a ',' (comma) separated list. Eg: pages=-3,-1,0,3 will create links for relative page -3, -1, current page and currentPage+3. The list supports ranges: [fromPage TO toPage] Eg pages=-5,[-3 TO 3],5 will create links to all pages +/-5 from current except -4 and +4

parameters.name: per_page
parameters.description: Set the number of items per page. Can be a number in the range [1,100] or the String MAX if reviewId is part of the url-path. Default value is 30

parameters.name: q
parameters.description:
Extra search filter:
  • q=\_missing\_:{fieldName}
    will filter the result listing all that don't have the field with the name {fieldName} set (where the field value is Null)
  • q=\_exists\_:{fieldName}
    will filter the result listing all that have the field with the name {fieldName} set (where the field value is NOT Null)
  • q={fieldName}:{searchString}
    will filter the result listing all objects that contain a field by the name {fieldName} containing the value {searchString}. {searchString} is caseInsensitive
  • q={searchString}
    will filter the result listing all objects that has a field containing the value {searchString}The exact phrase must exist in one of the fields in order to match (CaseSensitive)

parameters.name: sort
parameters.description: Sort the result in ascending or descending (-) order. The list can be comma separated specifying the order of sorting. Eg: sort=number,-name to sort first by number in ascending order and then by name in descending order

parameters.name: expand
parameters.description: Expand tableBody and/or footnotes inside the AdditionalTable

put.summary: Puts a Collection of AdditionalTables from the review
put.description: Updates all AdditionalTables in the body, they must all be from the review.

parameters.name: reviewId
parameters.description: ReviewId of the Review

post.summary: Posts a Collection of AdditionalTables or a Single AdditionalTable into the review
post.description: Creates all AdditionalTables in the body (the body can be a Collection of AdditionalTables or a single AdditionalTable) on the review with {reviewId}. The response is always a Collection

parameters.description: ReviewId of the Review

delete.summary: Deletes a Collection of AdditionalTables from the review
delete.description: Deletes all the AdditionalTables in the body, they must all be from the review

parameters.name: reviewId
parameters.description: ReviewId of the Review

patch.summary: Patches a Collection of AdditionalTables from the review
patch.description: Updates all AdditionalTables in the body, they must all be from the review. Will only update the values explicitly listed in the response. It is NOT possible to set a value to Null - if this is needed, PUT should be used instead.

put.description: Updates all Analyses in the body on the review

parameters.description: ReviewId of the Review

requestBody.description: The Analysis or Analyses to update

post.summary: Posts a Collection of Analyses or a Single Analysis
post.description: Creates all Analyses in the body (the body can be a Collection of Analyses or a single Analysis). The response is always a Collection. Can also be used to copy a single Analysis. This is done by providing a copyOf-queryParameter and possibly a deepCopy-queryParameter to copy the subtree below a Analysis. In case of a copy - the result is the Analysis copied

parameters.name: reviewId
parameters.description: ReviewId of the Review

parameters.name: deepCopy
parameters.description: This is only valid if queryParameter: copyOf is set to a valid id. If set to true - will make a copy of all resources pointing to this Study

parameters.name: copyOf
parameters.description: If set, will ignore the payload of the request and make a copy of the resource with id={copyOf}. Will return an error if the id does not exist

requestBody.description: The Analysis or Analyses to create

parameters.description: Get relative page links in the result header. Must be a ',' (comma) separated list. Eg: pages=-3,-1,0,3 will create links for relative page -3, -1, current page and currentPage+3. The list supports ranges: [fromPage TO toPage] Eg pages=-5,[-3 TO 3],5 will create links to all pages +/-5 from current except -4 and +4

parameters.name: per_page
parameters.description: Set the number of items per page. Can be a number in the range [1,100] or the String MAX if reviewId is part of the url-path. Default value is 30

parameters.name: q
parameters.description:
Extra search filter:
  • q=\_missing\_:{fieldName}
    will filter the result listing all that don't have the field with the name {fieldName} set (where the field value is Null)
  • q=\_exists\_:{fieldName}
    will filter the result listing all that have the field with the name {fieldName} set (where the field value is NOT Null)
  • q={fieldName}:{searchString}
    will filter the result listing all objects that contain a field by the name {fieldName} containing the value {searchString}. {searchString} is caseInsensitive
  • q={searchString}
    will filter the result listing all objects that has a field containing the value {searchString}The exact phrase must exist in one of the fields in order to match (CaseSensitive)

parameters.name: sort
parameters.description: Sort the result in ascending or descending (-) order. The list can be comma separated specifying the order of sorting. Eg: sort=number,-name to sort first by number in ascending order and then by name in descending order

parameters.name: download
parameters.description: Triggers the browser to set the download flag. The parameter is the filename

parameters.name: envelope
parameters.description: Surround the result with additional information

parameters.name: excluded
parameters.description: Comma separated list of fields that should be excluded from the result. It is not possible to set both excluded and included. Default value is set to: versionTime, createdBy, createdByClientId, deletedBy, deletedByClientId, versionNo

parameters.name: included
parameters.description: Comma separated list of fields that should be included in the result. It is not possible to set both excluded and included.

parameters.name: print
parameters.description: PrettyPrint (print=pretty) the result or don't send anything back in the payload (print=silent)

parameters.name: metadata
parameters.description: Add additional metadata as links and total count

parameters.name: time
parameters.description: Specify a timestamp in millis for versioned data

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: Get a specific page in the result

parameters.name: pages
parameters.description: Get relative page links in the result header. Must be a ',' (comma) separated list. Eg: pages=-3,-1,0,3 will create links for relative page -3, -1, current page and currentPage+3. The list supports ranges: [fromPage TO toPage] Eg pages=-5,[-3 TO 3],5 will create links to all pages +/-5 from current except -4 and +4

parameters.name: per_page
parameters.description: Set the number of items per page. Can be a number in the range [1,100] or the String MAX if reviewId is part of the url-path. Default value is 30

parameters.name: q
parameters.description:
Extra search filter:
  • q=\_missing\_:{fieldName}
    will filter the result listing all that don't have the field with the name {fieldName} set (where the field value is Null)
  • q=\_exists\_:{fieldName}
    will filter the result listing all that have the field with the name {fieldName} set (where the field value is NOT Null)
  • q={fieldName}:{searchString}
    will filter the result listing all objects that contain a field by the name {fieldName} containing the value {searchString}. {searchString} is caseInsensitive
  • q={searchString}
    will filter the result listing all objects that has a field containing the value {searchString}The exact phrase must exist in one of the fields in order to match (CaseSensitive)

parameters.name: sort
parameters.description: Sort the result in ascending or descending (-) order. The list can be comma separated specifying the order of sorting. Eg: sort=number,-name to sort first by number in ascending order and then by name in descending order

post.summary: Posts a Collection of References or a Single Reference
post.description: Creates all References in the body (the body can be a Collection of References or a single Reference). The response is always a Collection. Can also be used to copy a single Reference. This is done by providing a copyOf-queryParameter and possibly a deepCopy-queryParameter to copy the subtree below a Reference. In case of a copy - the result is the Reference copied

parameters.name: reviewId
parameters.description: ReviewId of the Review

parameters.name: studyId
parameters.description: Id of the Study

parameters.name: deepCopy
parameters.description: This is only valid if queryParameter: copyOf is set to a valid id. If set to true - will make a copy of all resources pointing to this Study

parameters.name: copyOf
parameters.description: If set, will ignore the payload of the request and make a copy of the resource with id={copyOf}. Will return an error if the id does not exist

parameters.name: pages
parameters.description: Get relative page links in the result header. Must be a ',' (comma) separated list. Eg: pages=-3,-1,0,3 will create links for relative page -3, -1, current page and currentPage+3. The list supports ranges: [fromPage TO toPage] Eg pages=-5,[-3 TO 3],5 will create links to all pages +/-5 from current except -4 and +4

parameters.name: per_page

parameters.name: q
parameters.description:
Extra search filter:
  • q=\_missing\_:{fieldName}
    will filter the result listing all that don't have the field with the name {fieldName} set (where the field value is Null)
  • q=\_exists\_:{fieldName}
    will filter the result listing all that have the field with the name {fieldName} set (where the field value is NOT Null)
  • q={fieldName}:{searchString}
    will filter the result listing all objects that contain a field by the name {fieldName} containing the value {searchString}. {searchString} is caseInsensitive
  • q={searchString}
    will filter the result listing all objects that has a field containing the value {searchString}The exact phrase must exist in one of the fields in order to match (CaseSensitive)

parameters.name: sort
parameters.description: Sort the result in ascending or descending (-) order. The list can be comma separated specifying the order of sorting. Eg: sort=number,-name to sort first by number in ascending order and then by name in descending order
